disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about the advantages and risks of laser lipolysis (laser-assisted liposuction). Read thoroughly and discuss with your practitioner before proceeding.

Take time to consider all options, seek second opinions, and ask questions. Laser lipolysis uses fiber-optic laser energy delivered through tiny incisions to liquefy targeted subcutaneous fat cells in areas like abdomen, thighs, arms, or chin, followed by gentle aspiration. Local anesthesia used; sessions last 30-90 minutes depending on areas treated. Promotes skin tightening via collagen stimulation; results visible in 1-3 months with final contour at 6 months. Not for weight loss or obesity; multiple sessions may be needed.

Wear compression garments 2-4 weeks post-treatment; avoid strenuous activity 1-2 weeks. Informed of practitioner each session; withdraw consent anytime.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: swelling, bruising, tenderness, numbness (resolves 2-4 weeks). Less common: infection, seroma (fluid collection), uneven contours, skin burns, hyperpigmentation.

Rare: fat embolism, organ perforation, prolonged pain, paradoxical adipose hyperplasia. Contraindications: pregnancy, active infection, blood clotting disorders, uncontrolled diabetes, liver/heart disease, obesity BMI>30.

I confirm understanding of procedure reasons, risks (including not treating), personal health risks, benefits, alternatives (traditional liposuction, CoolSculpting, diet/exercise), uncertainties, follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photos/videos for confidential records.

I certify reading/understanding this form, questions answered satisfactorily, and consent to procedure.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
